oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Note onset detection in natural humming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PRADEEP, KP
RAO, P
ROY, SD
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Many state-of-the-art query-by-humming (QBH) systems restrict the hummed query to be in isolated syllables for easy note segmentation. However, it is observed that users often prefer natural humming. This work addresses note onset detection for natural hum, usually considered difficult to segment. The acoustic characteristics of naturally hummed signals are studied and features useful to note onset detection are proposed. Pitch and energy features are combined to obtain superior note segmentation. Performance results on note onset detection as well as retrieval in an actual QBH system are reported.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: ICCIMA 2007: INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON COMPUTATIONAL INTELLIGENCE AND MULTIMEDIA APPLICATIONS, VOL IV, PROCEEDINGS,176-180
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 7th International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Multimedia Applications,Sivakasi, INDIA,DEC 13-15, 2007
